description:
Taqueria Mana is quite the epitome of a hole-in-the-wall type of joint. Being next to the Stockton Tunnel probably doesn't add to the fancy points but it's cheap, efficient, and all-in, pretty tasty. 

All the usual faves like burritos, tacos, and quesadillas but they also have more homey classics like sopes and mole poblano. Also burgers and salads plus a whole host of entree plates. My lunch go-to is a baby burrito and I find it to be right-sized for a satisfying lunch that doesn't weigh you down. Lots of meat options from your regular carne asada and carnitas to not so common barbacoa and lengua. Breakfast burritos are also super welcomed on slightly hungover mornings. 

Folks are friendly here and try to get you in and out quickly. Major plus that they take cards too. For a cheap lunch by Union Square, Taqueria Mana is modest looking and slightly off the beaten path, but more than handles itself with it's wide menu.
author: Jon L.

description:
FIRE, 
SMAKIN, 
ON POINT, 
THATS THAT AHIT RIGHT THERE,
What ever yo want to call it this was a good burrito and I will be coming here for breakfast for at least a month strait. It not too expensive it's right down the street from the shopping centers so it's a good location for you on the go cats. And ally cats alike. If breakfast is this bomb I have to believe that the lunch it just as good. I'm a fat eater and this one I had to slow down and enjoy. I would recommend this place to anybody
author: Richard R.

description: My husband and I shared a #1, wet burrito with pastor and chocolate shake (!). The burrito was good, maybe a little dry on the inside. I liked the red sauce on top. The shake was good, more of a surprise that it was there. Will go there again.
author: Christina V.

description: I usually love hole in the wall places but the food tasted very bland for a place that seemed so authentic. The tacos at the food trucks near my house are way better. Something about the meat here is off. Also, they overcharged me for a "custom item" I did not order and then blatantly lied about it being a fee that everyone pays when I asked. Not a large amount  but it really really bothers me when people do business like this. Be careful if you are not Mexican..
author: Jessica S.

description: AUTHENTIC AS AUTHENTIC CAN GET!!! Great food at a good price all things considered, located right down the street from china town this place is truly a hidden gem! Recommend to all those seeking delicious Mexican food nothing like the horrible   quality most restaurant sell in today's day and age. Taqueria Mana
author: Jordan R.

description: So good! I could've made a meal of just the soft warm, slightly crisp, tortilla my super veggie burrito was wrapped in. Huge burrito, tasty black beans, crunchy lettuce. Make this whole-in-the-wall your next stop!
author: Emily M.

description: Great food, quick service fantastic staff!! I recommend eating here. Lots of healthy options!!
author: Charles F.

description: An old fav when I worked around the corner, and now that I moved to the area, I go often! Everyone is very nice! It's clean and there's a lot of space to sit and eat, or wait for your to-go order. The nachos are the best and the wet burrito is delicious! They even have milkshakes (I really love milkshakes lol). This is a nice taqueria for the area!
author: Kristal R.

description: Alfredo and Jose are a dream team,they always deliver!! The food is delicious and my office always loves when I bring tacos!!
author: Kelly A.

description: don't do it. who thinks they can get away with that horrible salsa? i'm upset. i'm offended. never again buhbye
author: Kelly T.

description:
How hard is it to make a burrito to a customers liking.   Starting with the guy who took my order: he could not take his eyes off a woman's chest long enough to look at me while I ordered.   

My order is pretty simple:
super carnitas burrito, re fried beans, extra cheese (paid extra dollar) and NO salsa.  

What I received super carnitas burrito, re fried beans, EXTRA SALSA , and NO CHEESE!

There was a grand total of two people in front of me inline when I walked in, and maybe three customer ordered and waiting, yet it took 22 minutes of my 30 minute lunch break to make me the wrong burrito. You had the time, still couldn't get it right

Safe to say I won't be eating here again.
author: Nathan K.

description: Great California Steak n Cheese Fries. They delivered up to my apartment and Delivered. Not every restaurant do that.
author: Glen W.

description: You can definitely do better in San Francisco. The rice and beans were good and it certainly wasn't dry but their al pastor, which dominated the flavor of the burrito was definitely off. It just tasted more like bad chorizo with an overwhelming paprika flavor.
author: Artur R.

description: Meh. The meat on the mini-tacos was severely under seasoned, and it was literally 50 degrees in the restaurant. The staff was extremely friendly, and they would have made up for the seasoning issue had I been wearing a beanie and jacket.
author: Ben L.

description: Love their tacos- good quantity of filling and tasty. Just skip the cheese. $1.00 for what appears to be Kraft singles layered between the tortilla and the filling.
author: Johanna S.

description:
Average at best.  I've been here twice as it's about two blocks from my office.  The first time I got a grilled chicken baby burrito, and the second time, I got a chili verde regular burrito.  Both times the meat was dry, and the chili verde pork's meat was a bit hard.  At least they didn't lie about it being spicy.    The chicken was pretty bland too.  

During the lunch time only one gentleman was working the cashier, and one guy was making orders.  I saw some people back in the kitchen but I wasn't sure what they were doing.  So, they're not as quick as other taquerias.  I waited probably about 10 minutes or so for my burrito.  

Prices aren't bad, but they're still not as cheap as Gordo's or other taquerias, but this is probably due to the location.  I heard one taco was $4.  My burrito was around $7ish.  They're on Eat24 and take card.  I would say if you're desperate for Mexican food in the area, then maybe come here.  Though I heard the taqueria on Mason isn't bad, and Tropisueno, though pricier is solid.
author: Cat C.

description: I was so impressed! I've been looking for my go to spot in the city for 6 months now and am proud to have found it. GREAT price, perfectly seasoned and awesome spice!
author: Bre F.

description:
This small taqueria can be found just before the tunnel near Boba Guys, which is one of my favorite boba shops.

Max capacity in this restaurant would probably be 15.

I ordered the small burrito combo which came with a drink and chips. I actually thought that the chips would be bigger, but in fact, it was smaller than I thought.

Dipped my chips with some of the salsa on top of the table to give its spiciness. What I found hilarious was that they used the covers for the paper cups and used it as a cover for the salsa dip.

My burrito was average. For about $6.50, it was a decent meal and left me satisfied.
author: Aj C.

description:
Friendly service, yummy food, and average price. (Which means the burritos are affordable and filling!) THIS is the reason I go to this place.

There are so many new "cool-fusion-hipster-overpriced" taquerias around now, that I cant just get a basic yummy burrito without paying $12-15 bucks a pop!  Jezuz Criminey! 

THIS PLACE however has the right food for the right price.  Really, you guys are doing a great job. I go here for lunch at least twice to three times a month and I haven't gotten a bad meal yet.  

Even their burgers and fries are pretty tasty too.  Yes, yes, you can go somewhere else to pay $12-15 bucks for a fancy-schmancy burger with friggin sweet potato fries and fancy "dippin" sauce...  but i'm talking tasty value here people. Tasty value. gawd.

Anyway... see you guys next week for more food, keep up the good work.
author: Pavle R.

description: I just ordered from this place, it was disgusting! When the food came it was cold, the plate was soggy like it had been sitting in the bag forever. The food looked like it been thrown in the plate, it didn't look good at all 22.00 dollars for a nasty quesadilla smh. I wish I didn't have to even give a star
author: Jazmine H.

description: Love this place the quality is always great and the prices are amazing for San Francisco. I come here for lunch with co workers and the people are always welcoming and friendly. I definitely recommend trying the California fries they are  amazing.
author: Dannie M.

description:
We switched up from pizza to burritos one day when ordering lunch for about 27 people on a busy project. I found Taqueria Mana on seamless web, but checked Yelp to make sure that they were good enough for the crew.

I recognized this as the spot that I used to go to after a little FiDi Happy Hour at the Tunnel top, late night. So I processed by order through Seamless Web. 

I ordered 27 Burritos with Chips. Half Carne Asada, Half Grilled Chicken.  placed the order and the delivery was so close to the opening time, I wanted to make sure that they could arrive on time for lunch at12:00 p.m. To be honest, I was worried and then when my boss asked to expedite the lunch.

I received a call from Taqueria Mana to confirm my order and was able to bump up the delivery even though they open at 11:00 a.m. and the order window was 11:45 a.m. It was amazing how fast they were. 

They delivered two bags of burritos and a huge tray of chips and pint sized salsa tubs. Everyone seemed to enjoy the switch up in the work day lunch, although I think I would order the sautéed chicken instead of grilled next time. 

Great job on the big last minute delivery order. Thank you!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Mmmmm! Stopped in here for a quick lunch bite while working my way towards Chinatown. The counter guy recommended the shrimp burrito for my mild hangover and he was spot on. It was fresh and had the right balance of beans and shrimp and tasty veggies.

The place is tiny and the service was terrific. A wonderful find!
author: Lisa S.

description:
This is a very good burrito spot. Had the carne asada burrito and it was excellent. Tastes like they actually marinade or season the meat. Worth your time if you are in the area and want a burrito. They have all the meat choices so if you are feeling like carnitas or Al pastor you can get that too.

Clientele is mostly locals so not a huge wait. Recommend.
author: Bill H.

description: We order food here from time to time at my job and are never ever disappointed. Sizable portions of fantastic Mexican food that will have you craving a nap afterwards. My personal favorite is the chimichanga which is superb and for extra flavor get it with the enchilada sauce poured over it. It's very mom and pop which I love versus going to chipotle and you honestly get more bang for your buck. A true hidden gem
author: Dominick R.

description: Hella good these guy did a menudo that was the perfect Sunday soup!!  Real cool people very chill!
author: Alex G.

description: I'm sure the food would have been good...if it wasn't over an hour late. I ordered from this place through waiter.com for cash payment and delivery. Apparently the restaurant thought i was picking it up for some reason and a half hour after the food was to have been delivered...realized it was delivery. Not pick up. I requested fresh food be made and they didn't do it. Instead of using a waiter.com delivery person they used a bike messenger who crammed our food into their backpack. The food arrived an hour late...was cold and soggy. The packaging was crushed from the backpack and one of the burritos was half unwrapped and broken up. Disgusting. I had to throw everything away. Oh and they forgot our large expensive order of guacamole and chips on top of that.
author: Angela O.

description: Great burritos for a good price. Multiple hot sauce choices that have both fire and flavor. First time I broke a sweat in SF and that's what I look for. Absolutely recommend
author: Ryan C.

description: Awesome food for a great value. Everything was fresh tasty yummy (FTY). Go often and enjoy the little money spent.
author: Fred B.

description: I've been coming here for years. A few days ago I ordered a shrimp burrito. I totally forgot they add mushrooms and bell peppers. Once I got my burrito I brought it back to get one with mushrooms and bell peppers. I asked them to change my order and The short lady at the register said okay and didn't take my burrito. I sat back down and she finally came over and asked me what was on my burrito. As I tried to tell her SHE WALKED AWAY! Then I got up and I asked her why she walked away and then she acted like she didn't understand a word I was saying. I will never return here again because she was soooo rude.
author: Crystal M.

description:
One of my good friends lives in this neighborhood and we decided to stop here before heading to Dolores Park for a b-day party on Saturday. 

I ordered the taquito plate and thought that I could get french fries instead of the rice and beans. This turned into an unfortunate mistake as the cashier got confused and I ended up with just some taquitos and fries. No salsa, no guacamole, no ketchup. So I asked for everything after the fact and was charged an extra dollar for the guacamole, when in fact it should of been included in the meal.  I was not disappointed in the taquitos or the fries flavor or quality as you can't really mess up something that is fried and delicious. 

My friend ordered the mini tacos and was disappointed when she ate them at the park. She didn't get the hot sauce on the tacos and was upset that the beef had no flavor. The tacos included onion and cilantro, but this did not amp up the flavor. 

At the party we referred to our individual portion meals as the mediocre Mexican food. Everyone scolded us for not grabbing food in the mission as its known for its exceptional Mexican food. I've learned my lesson, no more mediocre Mexican food when we're headed to the mission. I figure if your hungry this place is an option for basic Mexican food I was starving so it was good.
author: Ebonie M.

description:
Food wise: I had a delicious authentic burrito! Flour tortilla, refried beans, red rice!! Guacamole was fresh, not heat on sour cream! I like that they have a veggie option for every dish! Quesadilla, nachos, tacos, burgers. Staff was really friendly. 

Very small, can get crowded on the inside, and busy!
author: Laura S.

description:
As far as hole in the wall taquerias go this one is pretty good. Food was surprisingly good, the al pastor and carnitas tacos were really good. Definitely one of the best tasting el pastor I have had. People are friendly. Decent prices but they charge for chips and salsa which is a pet peeve of mine. That and the place wasn't very clean, meaning the staff should clean the floor and tables more. The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars.
I will definitely be back.
author: Jeramy W.

description:
I came out  here for while I was on a vacation with my husband for a get away and found this taco spot! I was craving tacos so we gave it a shot! 
I ordered 2  carne Asade tacos and rice and beans! And my husband ordered a burrito! Well those tacos were so Delicious I went back in line to order 2 more! Ughhh I had to ! Nice people here and order was pretty fast! And hot
author: Gianna M.

description: Ive came here a few times after and Im sad to say that i wont be returning. The staff are super nice and they get your food out quick & give great portions but the food just isnt good.... The food isnt fresh and really can taste that. The meat isnt good quality and even the guacamole is browning and pico de gallo just tastes old. Sad to say will no longer be coming here.
author: Xochitl T.

description: Excellent family run taqueria.  Stopped in for a breakfast burrito and had one of the best in years. A good "hole in the wall".
author: Chris K.

description:
I'm already a fan so I'd give four stars but I think they keep stealing money from me. I think the food is great and a bit pricey. They do one of those "this is the price on the menu" and then you go in the prices have changed and/or they add a big tax on there. No gratuity needed!

I like the interior, it's great with paintings of pyramids on the walls near the cash and they even laminated the fridge machine with sparkly gold.

They have shakes (chocolate!) Extra props for shakes. What kind of burrito place has that? Then there's vanilla and I think strawberry.
author: M R.

description: A very awesome place serving delicious Mexican food. My friend (a Mexican) really enjoyed thier shrimp burritoes. I love this place because it is close to the union square and the Hyatt building where I attended a conference. Plus, the food amount is large and the prize is reasonable. Foods taste great as well. The taqueria is not big so keep an eye on your left when you walk towards the tunnel.
author: Tim L.

description: Hole in the wall taqueria that also has burritos, quesadillas, tamales and sandwiches. Fish tacos were on flour tortillas with pico de gallo, lettuce and sour cream. They use catfish. It was freshly fried, but lacked seasoning. An affordable and quick option for lunch just a few blocks from union square.
author: Karen B.

description: My go to place to pick up a fast lunch. I usually order online which makes things so much faster, i can go up front and avoid the line out the door. The tacos are pretty good, they have a good selection on drinks and the milkshakes are delicious.
author: Carina P.

description: I was in the area sightseeing and stopped in for a bite, and am glad I did! Ordered the sopas and they were done excellently. Great staff, cool location, right next to the Stockton St. Tunnel.
author: David P.

description:
This is easily the best hole-in-the-wall Mexican food place you can find around downtown or Nob Hill. Emphasis on hole-in-the-wall. If you grew up in some sheltered suburb or are some uptight financial district person looking for a nice sit-down place to eat, this probably isn't your joint.

Their wet burrito and super nachos are both absolutely fantastic. The portions are quite generous and affordable by San Francisco standards -- you can make away with a filling Mexican meal for around $10. The staff is always quite friendly, too. The only con is that they don't serve horchata! However the Boba Guys next door kind of does.
author: George L.

description:
I like this place.  The service is quick and friendly. The food is reasonably priced and tastes quite good. Plus, they support Mogl, which is an added bonus.

Honestly, I'd probably be right at about 3.5 stars. Gotta round up to 4.
author: Alex D.

description:
Terrible delivery experience! Ordered a large lunch order for work at 1130 and food took 2 HOURS to arrive even though the seamless confirmation email said it would only take 30-45 min. They also appeared to charge my credit card multiple times and even automatically charged a tip for themselves!!! 

Burritos arrived cold. Didn't even come with chips/salsa. They ran out of the Snapples we ordered too. 

Awful customer service and manager said "do you still want the food?" after we had already waited an hour and they hadn't even started making the order. No one from the restaurant called to say it was going to be late.

Since the order was for an office event, everyone was hungry and the food came well after the lunch hour.

Zero stars. Negative stars!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I eat a lot. 2 Super Tacos from this place adds up to $8 and gets me full and satisfied. They really pile on the meat, guac, sour cream and pico de gallo. NOM!!

Taking a star off because the place is a little dirty, has only one Tabasco bottle and the workers there usually seem a little "out of it".
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Fat tacos. Fat burritos. Simply delicious carne asada everything girlllllll YES!

The freshly squeezed orange juice tastes just like when my grandma used to squeeze oranges for OJ for me. It's a dope spot right underneath Bush St, on Stockton outside of Union Square. I've eaten there and have taken out of towners here between 5-10 times and never had a complaint.
author: Felicia R.

description:
Good food, fast service. Good portions for the price. Lots of selection too, including things like burgers.

I had the fajitas de res, and they are great!
author: Alex L.

description: I guess it's an okay place if your not running to the bathroom to blow it up right?!?!?!
author: Lucy S.

description: I discovered this place via a PayPal deal.  I have to say, at first I was skeptical, the place looks like a hole-in-the-wall right next to the Stockton tunnel.  But the food is actually really good!  The thing that stood out the most was that they put a lot of meat in their burritos, so you get your money's worth.  The burritos are also a good size.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Love the location, feels like eating in a tunnel. Food was good and tasty, portions seemed a bit small. Dining area is festive and workable, but feels a little run down. Not terrible for a quick casual bite to get energy before standing in line for some Boba Guys tea next door.
author: K. C.

description:
Yup; Solid Mexican food.  The wet burrito was *way* bigger than it needed to be, and topped with guac and crema and pico it was fantastic. Their "mini" tacos are bigger than "mini" implies.  But delicious.

It's truly a hole-in-the-wall, but I think that's part of the attraction.

Staff was just as friendly and courteous as they could be.  Definitely this is going to be a regular stop on my route.
author: Steve S.

description: Great lunch spot if your in the area. The burritos here are very good. Line has never been long but if your in a hurry you can order online not a lot of seating but most take out. I usually get the super burrito with the shredded chicken. Oh and they have friendly order takers.
author: Thomas R.

description: Chicken quesadillas and menudo is bomb! Served nice and warm. Came here because I was told by several co workers to check it out. Had a great experience! The staff are nice and the food is awesome! It's almost hard to find the location of this place because it's right before the Chinatown tunnel.
author: Christopher R.

description:
This place was pretty good, I got the chicken nachos w/ everything and was very pleased and satisfied. 
This is more of a 3.5 rating
They're pretty good but I've had better, I am definitely a fan and will return
author: Imani T.

description: I had the Torta here. It was pretty chewy. I'm not sure if I just ordered the wrong item on their long and extensive list of choices, but it was okay. The meat was pretty chewy and it was diffcult to swallow. I got fries with the torta, but it didn't think it was enough. I suggest serving food in smaller plates if they want to give less fries, because on a bigger plate, you really notice that stuff. My Coworker liked it, and he said he'd come back if he was in the area.
author: Ameera D.

description:
The guy Screwed up my order. I requested a BLT sandwich and 3 chicken flautas. 
I only got 1 flauta.
He tried to get us to order drinks, but walgreen's has $1 20oz sodas. Therez also a liquor store 2 stores dwn

Ive beeen here 3x b4. Look for the women workers, more polite and gets the orders correct. 

Would have bn 3 stars but if u cant get the order, itz not deservin
author: Keikaikaoakua P.

description:
In the mood for Mexican? That wont cost much? This is your place! Taste good! Fast & local! 

Last night in SF and I wanted Mexican.  Compared to a lot of places around union Square i didn't want to spend much but want to munch down.  This place hit the spot!! The food was more nutritional and healthy then other greasy Mexican Joints.  What I ordered:


Super Quesadilla
$8.25
Flour tortilla, cheese, meat, sour cream, and guacamole. Served with rice, beans, sour cream, lettuce, and salsa. | Meat Choices: Boiled Chicken, Barbacoa (Shredded Beef), Carne Asada (Beef), Lengua (Beef Tongue), Grilled Chicken, Carnitas (Pork), Carne Molida (Ground Beef), Chorizo (Mexican Pork Sausage), Chile Verde (Spicy Pork), Pastor (Marinated Pork)

The Quesadilla was hot and served fresh! There was more food on my plate than I can handle and best of all it had healthy substitutes! So yummy! I must admit it is in a random spot but I bet you will enjoy as much as I did!
author: Connie G.

description:
I decided to try this place and called in for my order, but they told me they didn't have any carnitas. I talk to my girlfriend and she decided on barbacoa instead. When I called back they put me on hold for 5 minutes and I could tell that the lady had finished with her customers and started talking to the people in the back....obviously she forgot that i was on the phone. When I get there i order a two plates plus two sides of extra chicken and they ring me up. After a few minutes they call me and say they've run out of barbacoa....What kind of mexican place runs out of everything? Once i get my food and walk 15 minutes back to work..I realized they never included the extra chicken...what a surprise.

Please avoid this place - has horrible customer service and they also stole my money for the extra meat. Not cool.
author: Charles T.

description: $3.95 for a delicious bean and cheese burrito.  Great service and solid chips and salsa.  I'll be back for more options!
author: Sanket K.

description: It was aiiiight. The place is clean and I didn't find anything sketchy in my food and everything tasted very fresh buuuttttttttt we ordered a bunch of burritos and nobody thought their burrito had any flavor. Like can you please add some seasonings to the chicken when you are boiling it? Salt? Anything?
author: Free P.

description: Hole in the wall! Good food and cheerful service. The mini Tacos are great, and the baby burrito is a popular item on the menu.
author: Seerat S.

description: I have not been here in many years so I do not recall the last vague years ago.  Their Mana Burger to my surprise small as it was, so filling when size does not matter.  Their customer servicing can improve but it is a very busy place.
author: BanBan B.

description:
Decent taqueria in union square... Decent prices, they accept PayPal order or direct pay with your phone via the app.  Not the best or worst but fine... FYI - they do not have Wi-Fi, even though yelp shows that they do.  They do have electric outlets accessible to charge your phone, which is great.  

I've eaten here previously and it seemed better and a large portion.  Had the super veggie taco... I've had better but it wasn't terrible... But it's union square, if only based on your options around here, I'd up this review to four stars... But travel a bit and you'll get better.
author: Michael B.

description:
On the bright side, this place is super cheap. And the people are nice, friendly and helpful.
Everything pretty much goes downhill from there.
I had the big burrito (#1 on the menu) with carne asada. The meat tasted like it was day-old, or maybe worse. It was super dry and nearly rock hard. Not good at all. The rest of the burrito was passable, but the rice and beans had obviously been sitting around for quite a while. The enchilada sauce was okay, but not overly flavorful. The "salsa" on the tables had a good kick to it, but absolutely no flavor. It reminded me of an Asian pepper sauce, more than a salsa.
The restaurant is kinda dirty and run-down and just not all the comfortable.
I was really bummed out that THIS was my last meal on this trip to San Francisco. Oh well... lesson learned.
author: Charles S.

description: The shrimp burrito is on another level. It's so dope it should be illegal. Do it big for all my people.
author: Gene S.

description: This place is great. Large portions, great quality, great flavor. I loved the Shrimp Taco and Shrimp Burrito, and the Super Taco was excellent with chicken or beef. So far I'v been very happy with everything I've tried. I ordered online through Yelp/Eat24 and they had it ready by the time I got there. Perfect for a pickup on the way home at night.
author: Robin D.

description:
This might be the worst Mexican food I've ever had. The only reason I tried it was because of the convenience and it was available for online ordering pick up. 
So the food I ordered: cheese enchilada plate, shrimp plate, carne asada taco, shredded beef super nachos  and chips & salsa. The enchilada sauce was bland like straight from a can, shrimp had no flavor and was over cooked, rice was dry like from days before, nachos didn't have enough chips for the price, and the chips were stale. Overall bad food I general, not coming back.
author: Alisha R.

description: Super good food. I liked it. And the guys were pretty nice. Very tiny though and a hole in the wall.
author: Julia W.

description:
I am hooked on PASTOR CALIFORNIA FRIES.

I don't think it's on the menu. It's straight up stoner munchie food and yes it's high in anything that will pack those fat on your booty but just sit down and let me tell you about it:

- Juicy, spicy, pork al pastor
- salsa
- guacamole
- sour cream
- cheese
- beans

on top of fries.
Fatty talk! But it's so good...
author: Yuki A.

description:
My previous visit to Taqueria Mana was about 7 years ago...maybe even 8. Back then I ordered a super carne asada burrito and, to this day, I remember how terrible the meat was. I had to pick a piece of gristle out of nearly every mouthful.

Which explains why I hadn't been back in all these years.

I found myself walking past Mana at lunchtime today and on a whim decided to give it another shot. I was encouraged by the much nicer interior; they had really spruced up the place from what I remember. Would the food be better as well?

I ordered the same burrito and I can say that there has been an improvement in at least the texture of the meat. It was much more tender. Unfortunately, though, I detected an unwelcomed hint of gaminess. Granted, it wasn't bad enough to keep me from eating the whole thing!

If Mana were in the Mission, it might be a 2-star taqueria; however, the scarcity of places to get a burrito on this side of town bumps it to a 3 by default.
author: Valeria R.

description:
One bowl of Menudo + a can of coke + 3 small tacos = about $18.

I got 3 small carne asada tacos which had a lot of flavor and was good especially with a squirt of lime on top! And the menudo was good, too. The size for the menudo was decent for about $8. 

There's really not much to say. I paid, I got my food piping hot, and that was that. :D
author: Venus L.

description: To be honest, I've been to better Mexican restaurants along Mission street but I don't want to go that far. I pick this Mexican restaurant because it's the closest and better tasting amongst the rest nearby. I usually get grilled chicken and shredded chicken mini tacos or my all time favorite super baby nachos: grilled chicken, everything on it except no beans, add lettuce, guacamole and sour cream on the side. For me it's not bad a all. Im a regular here. I'm satisfied with my orders.
author: Sharmaine M.

description: Do not get the chile relleno. Maybe it was an off day, but it was awful. Only giving two stars because I've only been here once and am giving them the benefit of the doubt. Literally one of the worst chiles relleno I have ever had. A one star experience. I could not finish eating it. The sauce was basically canned tomato paste and oil.
author: Grant S.

description:
In San Fran for work, needed a quick meal as I had just arrived at hotel.  Yelped up casual Mexican near my hotel and found this place.  

Steak burrito was excellent, all ingredients pretty high quality.  Could see this as a regular lunch spot for me if I worked in the area.  NYC - particularly Manhattan, lacks solid Mexican food, so was especially enjoyable.
author: Matthew B.

description: The super burrito is the must have here. So many toppings, and bursting at the seams. It's even plentiful if you eat it sans meat. I actually ate half for lunch and saved the other half for dinner. As I was traveling to SF for work, I noticed that dining out in SF can be exorbitantly expensive. This place will fill you up without breaking the bank. And the takeout is lightning fast too, just what you're looking for when you're tired and hungry. Good selection of Mexican sodas too.
author: Jamie M.

description: Best burrito I've found near my office on New Montgomery. I think I'll be back frequently.
author: Jacob K.

description:
Way better than I was expecting.

I had the carne asada super burrito, and it was delicious.  The key to a great burrito is that every bite has to have a good mix of flavor and ingredients.   Every bite had that perfect mix of black beans, rice, meat, sour cream, guac, and whatever else was in there.  The price was about right, and totally worth it.  I will be coming back here soon for more.
author: Dave S.

description:
I tried this Taqueria because I had a certificate through Restaurant.com.
It never expires.

The person at the register declined to accept it, saying they no longer utilize the restaurant.com service, since 2013.  I got this certificate in July of 2014.  
"We no longer accept those, Boss"

Not wanting to cause a scene, I ordered my burrito.
It tasted OK, but was very dry.  I would not come back.
The guacamole was not of a great quality or taste, and everything else was dry.
The meat was well seasoned, and tasted pretty good, but it can't be saved amongst the dry burrito.

Boss, I will not be back.
author: Mike A.

description:
I've only ordered lunch from here twice. Both times I've tried the super burrito w/ carne asada. 

I can't quite put my finger on it but both times the food tasted off. Kind of like how if you leave something uncovered in a refrigerator warm it up and eat it. Just weird. Not totally disgusting and inedible, just a little bit funky. Someone else made mention about the cheese quality in their review.... maybe that's it. Funky cheese? 

Either way, I have no idea where else to go for Mexican food in this area so chances are when I'm craving it for lunch I will come back. I'll probably try something different. Like a taco or chimichanga.

They get a third star for the very friendly and comedic guy who answers the phone and works the register.
author: M E.

description: Ive finally found a fast food mexican joint that i absolutely love, i live by el zorro but f@#* them theyre no where near as good as taqueria mana they know how to get down in the kitchen lol , ty taqueria mana  for existing :)
author: Charissa L.

description:
This is the best Mexican food in the district and the people who work there are so friendly. 

They have a rather extensive menu and the food is reasonably priced. My favorite dish is the steak ranchero plate.

Speedy service and quality food, you can't beat that!
author: Abena O.

description:
This is my second time here. The first time I ordered a Chimichanga and I was not tasting anything...Is it really supposed to taste like nothing? My taste bud did not like it at all!

I came here again thinking my first visit, it could of been the chef making the food was bad, so I ordered a mojado burrito to give this restaurant another try. 
So a couple things wrong with food order that I ordered to-go. Mojado "WET" burrito means you shouldn't use a paper to-go box that does not have wax finishing so your sauce does not make the box soggy. When I was eating my burrito, I got a good dose of fiber from eating the soggy box... OR you could of put foil in the box so it doesnt soak up the sauce.

So the food...Nothing to really rave about. I was quite sad because this place could of been better.
author: Jade L.

description:
Came here for lunch, since it was recommended by a doorman of a hotel nearby.

Super burrito was about ~$8, and came packed with toppings.

I'd guess that it was 3in in diameter, which comes out to ~9.5in in radius. The complaint that I have is that it was thick enough that eating the burrito I had different strata of the burrito. (i.e. on the left was cheese, on the right was the meat... etc)

My meal was very quick to prepare. They do take credit cards.

They don't exactly have a large grill, so meat is pre-cooked and kept warm. Tortillas are heated and stuff is added. Guacamole was great, should've asked for more.
author: Shale C.

description:
I ordered the carne asada burrito from seamless.com for my lunch order at work.

-Was the grease seeping through the foil to my desk?
-Yes

-Was it delicious?
-Yes

I got the OJ on a whim as a 'healthy' chaser, it's fresh squeezed, win!
author: Angie Y.

description:
Staff is friendly and polite, but the food is awful. Let me elaborate...

I work down the street from this location. Me and my coworkers are all huge burrito fans and have tried every place that serves a burrito within a mile radius (unfortunately you can't get Mission quality in FiDi, sad). If you are a fan of cheese then this is NOT the place for you, the quality of cheese they use is a frankly disgusting deli sliced cheese (I've worked in Mexican/Tex Mex style restaurants for years and would never try and get away with using something of that quality, but again this is the owners fault not the staff). I am compelled to write this review because I feel physically sick/nauseous after eating my burrito.

I also ordered the carnitas which tasted old with a dry and hard texture, likely not made fresh and portioned incorrectly for the amount they turnover/sell. Sour cream tastes old as well. Requesting "spicy" food will not get you spicy food, as if expected to add their spicy salsa yourself (impractical for an online order as I do this for lack of time and explicitly say it in the notes). This is my one employee complaint because I requested something that wasn't done and it was not addressed to me ("hey we can't make it spicy"), I instead find out after my first bite.

Honestly I want to give this place a better rating, it's cool/small/friendly/convenient but the food is just sub par and an embarrassment to the Mexican food culture of SF. I never feel like writing a review (good or bad) because I don't have the time, but wanted to take the time to put one down here because I've had this recurring issue the last several times I have ordered here and hope to save others in the neighborhood who enjoy quality Mexican food the time and $8-$10. 

This is my final farewell to Taqueria Mana, I'll start making my burritos at home since that is the only way I will be able to get fresh/quality ingredients in my food in this area (I've joked that I need to open a burrito restaurant in this area since there are few in downtown that serve anything close to the quality in South City or the East Bay). Sorry guys, I tried to overlook these issues but it's too prevalent to merit return business and my office is now boycotting this location  and switching to Uno Dos Taco (smaller portions but you don't vomit them afterwards). 

I'm not sure if the owner is just cheap/stingy or simply unaware of how low quality these ingredients are compared to other taquerias; the cost difference between their ingredients and yours cannot be worth losing customers. Then again maybe your repeat customers simply don't mind, we however will not be returning.
author: Joseph W.

description:
Best taqueria food in the Financial District. If you work here, then this is all you need to know.

No, it isn't as good as the Mission.
No, it isn't as convenient as Chipotle.
No, they don't have the best salsa/chips/etc.
Yes, they have milkshakes and hamburgers on the menu.

Yes, this is your best option for Mexican.
author: Ben M.

description: This is a reasonably priced, family owned establishment with good, fresh, filling Mexican food.  Everyone is always helpful and friendly whenever I've gone into this place.  It's close to Union Square and convenient if you're looking for a quick bite/something to go.
author: Alacrity I.

description: Baby burrito was the perfect size and was absolutely delicious! At only $5 for a baby burrito, I would eat here for every meal. Hole in the wall establishment that might be passed over because of appearance, but definitely worth trying.
author: Kristi M.

description:
FINALLY a good Mexican joint. It's right before (or after) the Stockton tunnel depending on which direction you're walking. Food is pretty good, the cashier guys are super nice, and the service is quick. Seriously, what more do you really need?

If you work in the area, you can also order online (or just call them too). Big win. Definitely gonna make this my go-to Mexican spot for lunch
author: Diana Y.

description: What more could you want for a super burrito other than tasty filling and cheap. Yum.
author: Kristan B.

description: I was exploring downtown San Fran when I stumbled upon this place.  Being hungry and loving tacos,  I went in.  Fantastic decision on my part.  Great tacos,  Clean place,  will lit.  A very nice surprise for what looked to be a hole in the wall.  Worth the stop.
author: Jim F.

description:
Amazing chicken tacos--fresh and delicious. One of the best pepper hit sauces I've tasted. Not too hit, but a ton of spice and taste. 

Service is super friendly and food comes out quickly.
author: Laura S.

description: Breakfast review only here!  The breakfast burrito at Mana barely had egg in it so I started off a bit disappointed.  Then the potatoes were also a bit hard and the burrito overall was a bit dry so I wasn't too impressed with it here.  Hopefully they can improve, but alas, it's not a good option for the breakfast burrito IMHO...
author: Gene X.

description:
I would give zero stars if possible.  

We placed an order for delivery at the Hilton Hotel.  We placed an order for delivery.   And the order was never delivered.  When we called to find out what happened they lied and laughed at us.  Their customer service was horrible!!!
author: Xavier C.

description:
I live in the Mission but work right next to this place and I kinda love it.

It's a little greasy, so don't mind the fat and calories.  It's worth it.

Also- their chocolate shakes with cinnamon are pretty much my favorite thing ever.  So great.
author: Jenessa P.

description:
3.5 stars.

Tried the regular carne asada burrito 1st try and thought it was just mediocre. Then 2nd try I tried a super pollo asada burrito and was very impressed. Usually I'm not a big guac/sour cream fan but Mana definitely has some quality sour cream and guac!!! On point and blended very well with the scrumptious grilled chicken. And the customer service is quite good. Friendly, quick and offer plenty of room for you to sit down and enjoy your food.
author: Patrick O.

description: The food here is amazing for a good price. I highly recommend it for those that are in a budget but still want to have good serving food.
author: Estefania P.

description:
Was it the best breakfast burrito ever?  Well, it came mighty close.

After I finished up my physical at 450 Shudder Street I was starving and needed food and caffeine stat.  I headed into Taqueria Mana and chose a breakfast burrito with ham.  the other choices were chorizo, bacon or veggie.  The burrito was stuffed with chunks of tasty, salty ham, tons of fried potatoes and nice fluffy eggs.  My only regret is that I didn't ask them to add salsa to the inside of the burrito, which is the way I like it.

$4.65 - a pretty good deal for a really good burrito!
author: .Hon H.

description:
I don't know what I ordered but the picture on the wall looked good. So, I just said I'll have that. Well, "that" was really good. There was so much of it that I couldn't finiish it. 
Yeah, I'll be a repeat customer.
author: Brett W.

description: Good food and friendly service. I am a picky eater and had the cheese quesadilla and a vanilla milkshake. My husband also enjoyed his tacos.
author: Megan B.

description:
Everything me and my coworkers have ordered from here is really good. That says a lot since we have some picky eaters in my office. A simple bean, rice and meat burrito tastes amazing! 

Not only is the food amazing but the customer service is top notch! These guys made a mistake on my order and corrected it with a smile and exceeded my expectations in terms of correcting their mistake. I've been here many times and there will be many more times! 

Thanks!
author: Evelyn A.

description:
**3 STARS** relative to:
Mexican taquerias

I had the super burrito with carne asada and wasn't impressed. That's too bad because I was expecting a good burrito. The burrito was decent but didn't have me wanting to come back to try other things. The rice in my burrito was not warm, like it had been sitting out for a while, and the texture was gummy and clumpy. The meat was greasy and wasn't of great quality. All in all, I was disappointed with my burrito for $7.50, and I would go elsewhere to get my burrito fix when I'm in downtown.
author: Lovina C.

description:
i had an awesome experience here! friendly workers, and AMAZING carnitas! the burrito was bursting with flavor. imho, they're on the same page as burritos in the Mission. 

i recommend this joint!
author: Eduardo R.

description: Wow, big portions for the price! I got a wet burrito, so full of carne asada, that it lasted me 2 lunches. Also got a side of chips, all for a little over $10. Not bad. The location is just a bit hidden; you have to take the stairs to get below the pedestrian bridge.
author: Katherine S.

description: Good spot! Don't get the wet burrito if you're in professional attire ! Good, but next time I'll choose a more controlled meal. Service very good, water easily accessible without being wasteful.
author: Char D.

description:
Fresh & Flavorful. Taqueria in my backyard? Why not. And the second you order your meals, is the second they start up the grill to rustle it up.

- Chorizzo and Queso meal w/ black beans, cilantro, and rice
- Carne Asada Plate - Beef steak with grilled pepper, onions, mushrooms
- Fresh Orange Juice

And PS? The fresh OJ felt like it was literally, picked from the back and squeezed before my berry own eyes. it was delisioso!!!
author: Monalisa M.

description: This place is delicious and fresh. Sleepy little Mexican hide away tucked in by the bridge. Food was fresh, authentic and full of flavor. The guys working here were great too. Nothing fancy, just right for dropping by.
author: Kevin L.

description: The carne asada super burrito is the best I've had in this area! They are super fast and friendly too, a lunchtime favorite in our office!
author: Caitlin S.

description: Im not going to go on here. It is what it is. It is cheap and good tacos, actually they are pretty damn good tacos. I wasnt expecting mucn but was good enough for me to give it praise here on yelp. Wouldnt make an outing to find this place, but if youre in the mission and starving, then yes this is worth stopping in for food!
author: E B.

description: 1.5hr wait for delivery. Delivery guy gave me the impression that he was expecting a tip. Food was COLD and got my order WRONG. My first and last time ordering and/or eating from this place. Blah! Yuck.
author: Ane T.

description:
Nice find in an odd location.  Very small place with quick service and a big menu.  

I had tacos of course (el pastor) and they were solid.  Exactly what I was looking for.  

I dig the fact that you can order them a couple of ways:
 - simple with onion, cilantro and lime (my favorite)
 - or a couple increasingly more unattractive ways (cheese, avocado, etc.)

It's tiny, it's fast, you may have to clean a table before sitting down, you'll get really good tacos.
author: Allen L.

description: I live very close to Taqueria Mana, and I like that they do online ordering, so I picked up a taco salad this afternoon. I wasn't very happy with the chicken; it was pretty bland. The guac wasn't great either. Incredibly cheap. It's in an odd location, and the inside was (like others have described as) unflattering. The man working was friendly though! I will probably give this place one more chance in the future.
author: Kristy C.

description: Very very good and tasty food. The place is very nice and clean and the food is very fresh. They make one of the best burritos in San Francisco. i recommend this place very highly.
author: Siroos H.

description: Great Mexican food. The portions were huge and well seasoned at a great price.  It was in a convenient location and you can call ahead and order so it is ready when you get there.  We ate the super taco, super burrito and super nachos.  Loved all of them!
author: Babs O.

description: Why can't I give this place zero stars?!  We called for a delivery order *the day before* for our 12:00pm staff meeting.  At 12:15, we called and they said sorry for being late, they were really busy.  At 12:45, the meeting was over and still no food.  We called and they apologized, saying that they will start on our order right away.  WTF?!? Absolutely unacceptable!!  Who does that?  Just let us know you're incompetent to fulfill our 11 burrito order and we'll go somewhere else.  Never again...
author: J T.

description: When we lived nearby, we ate Taqueria Mana at least twice a week. Quick, good price. If you get chicken, make sure you ask for the grilled chicken. Massive plates of nachos, gigantic burritos. Wish the chips were made in house - my only complaint.
author: Rachael B.

description: I ordered No. 16 - Regular Quesadilla with beef. It's come with rice, bean, lettuce, Salsa and sour cream. I really LIKE it! Love their Salsa with sour cream very much. :D
author: Orange S.

description: I wouldn't do it again. Lady took my money and then went to make a meal for a prior order not even washing her hands. Kind of gross. I was trying to locate their city inspection card and couldn't find one, not a good sign.
author: Ger L.

description:
I just stumbled on this place yesterday. I had the chorizo torta. It was FABULOUS! Crumbly, spicy chorizo spilling out of the sandwich, crisp fresh onions, yumalicious tomato. Best of all-- they asked if I wanted sour cream or mayo! Now, I know purists will react with disgust, but I can't eat sour cream. And yes, I love mayo. AND the torta comes with french fries! Mayo and fries at a taqueria? Horribly Americanized? I prefer to think of it as low-rent fusion cuisine.

I'll definitely be back to try the burritos, etc., but also the burgers and cheesesteaks. Yes, a taqueria that makes philly cheesesteaks. Again, some people will consider that just plain wrong. But for me, it's food heaven.

And I've finally found  a good taqueria downtown!
author: Robert C.

description:
A coworker told me about this place many years ago because I would tell him I'm craving a burrito, but I dont want one of those fancy pants burrito places (i.e. 360 degree burritos)  I wanted a home made "real" taqueria!  And around Union Square all these fancy places were popping up. No Bueno!  

So I went here and its a small family owned place thats an authentic tacqueria. No frills and fancy meats.  It was very tiny before, but now for a few years now its much bigger and the menu has expanded.  They serve everything from burritos and quesadillas to menudo to huevos rancheros!  Yes....awesome place to go even though they've raised their prices from before.  Its understandable...its close to Union Square.  Rent isnt cheap.  My favorite is the super burrito mojado.  Its a super burrito drenched with enchilada sauce, but I always asked for the mole sauce which I like better.  A nice place for something quick and easy and real mexican food!
author: Gina S.

description:
Good selection of food with American options.
Chicken sandwich was yummy and mini tacos were okay. Menu on yelp was very helpful, because it covered the specifics decently. Wall menu had no details. 
Guy behind counter was giggly... He got my order right, so it's cool.
Closed sundays. Right below the Bush overpass so you can take the stairs down. Close to liquor stores and bars.
author: Heather M.

description: I enjoyed the tacos (especially the shredded pork and the chorizo). Quality ingredients and different options for what size of taco you want and how "loaded" you want it. I was visiting the city and returned for breakfast - really enjoyed the huevos chorizo (with rice and beans, pico de gallo, and corn tortillas). There was a lot and I took 1/3 of it in a doggy bag. Very friendly service. If you're looking for trendy or modern decor this will not be your place, but if you are looking for a casual place where the focus is on the food / ingredients (as I was), you'll be happy.
author: Jet J.

description:
Get some salsa habanera for the torta.  I ate sopes too, before a homeless man asked me for my leftovers. I had this for lunch and dinner.  I love lengua. It's better than barbacoa or chicken.

I liked watching Spanish PBS and I never had to clean a table. I love the red sea mural but some Asian office worker was eating in front of it. I recommend this if you have Mexican cravings in Chinatown or Nob Hill. My boyfriend loved the Mexican Coca Cola.
 
The carnitas burrito is okay but try the chimichangas!  The strawberry shake is good.  The workers are friendly. They top of the rice  drink with a lot of cinnamon because it's a little watery.  You have a choice of mayo or sour cream on the tortas.
author: Ai M.

description: This is a great place for good Mexican food at great value.   I've had a few items from this spot and they have all been solid.   The sopes are very good.... and I too enjoy the chicken caldo.   The food is fresh and has great flavor.
author: David C.

description:
I've seen this place so many times, and yet never popped in. Today was the day ...

At first I was a little overwhelmed with this place, as all the menu items (more or less) are arranged around the top of the walls, up against the ceiling. I didn't even notice the menu on the wall at first. I had a veggie burrito, to go, and it was prepared with astonishing speed. Like, they were ready to go. Maybe it was because I ordered in Spanish? I dunno. But you rarely have such short turnaround time for a good burrito. And this burrito was mighty tasty.

Now that I know they can do burritos well, I am encouraged to try their other items. Since they offer everything from hamburgers to Philly cheese steaks and quesadillas, I'm sure this place will be fun to sample over the coming months.
author: Wes T.

description:
After finishing up a good day at the Asian art museum, myself and a notably picky vegetarian friend, found ourselves in dire need of sustenance, and lo did the iPhone tell me of the Taqueria Mana.

We went there, and ordered what appeared to be your average Carne Asada burrito with all the fixings, and for her, a vegetarian taco plate.

What came was deliciousness, and it was good. Her taco plate came with more than just beans, cheese and rice, but also had guacamole and pico de gallo.

My burrito was juicy, the tortilla heated just right, and stuffed fully of meaty delicious goodness.

If you are in the area, find this place, it's tiny, and they don't really heat the place, but damned if the food is worth it.
author: James S.

description:
OMG, I'm from New Orleans and was CRAVING! This place is a hole in the wall BUT, very good! 
The price is extremely good for it being DA SAN Franciscoish price range. 
VERY worth trying and meat is freshly cooked.

TRY it!
author: Pablo C.

description:
Love these guys.  Super tacos and quesadillas are great.  Prices are great too, $5 for a super taco.  What a deal!  Perfect for a working gal's lunch.  Everyone is SUPER nice and remembers me when I come in.   My co-workers and I all go there all the time.  Oh, and the chicken soup hits the spot like no other, with huge chunks of chicken, not too salty, lots of cilantro, and some nice zing from the lime wedges they give you.
Total hole in the wall, but solid home-made food for cheap and nice, friendly staff.
Oh, and the random stuff on the TV makes the short wait kinda fun.
author: Olga B.

description:
Shockingly good!

The Beef Quesadilla is a winner for me, though the best part are the re-fried beans. I'm guessing there's a ton of lard and salt. Nothing healthy can taste that good!

Normally I do not like Mexican food, and I've unwillingly dined at many, many, many a taqueria. This place deserves my return visit.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Minus one star for no limes :( maybe next time I will ask.

Three mexican street (or mini) tacos, $2 a piece, and a side of rice for $1.75, I am a happy camper. Great good, great taste. A delicious hole in the wall under a tunnel, and you probably walk by and don't even see it.

This is becoming my new favorite lunch spot.
author: sierra s.

description: Hole-in-the wall, but with really friendly staff and an awesome burrito. I got one with shredded pork and it was amazing!
author: Olivia Z.

description:
Quite possibly the worst pork burrito I've ever eaten. The meat was literally unchewable, had to keep spitting it out. Got a few bites in and threw the full thing away. 

Maybe I just got unlucky, but I can't say I'm eager to ever try that place again.
author: Jacques C.

description: Found this place on Yelp and saw how close it was to where I work, I thought id give it a shot. After a short 1.5 minutes of walking, I walked up to this restaurant (very easy to miss if you are driving) and stepped inside. I was greeted to a few tables, chairs, colorful decor and friendly staff. I had ordered my food online and paid in advance, the online ordering system is very well organized and user friendly! The staff had my food waiting so after picking it up I walked back to my office and it took me all but 7 minutes to down the burrito! This place has some really good Mexican food and it def. will be a to go spot for me when I am craving some Mexican food! If you are in the union square/financial district area and want some bomb Mexican food, def. give this place a visit!
author: Imran M.

description:
Hidden but worth finding.

Had a really good grilled chicken burrito, light on the oil, heavy on the grilled veggies. The latter makes their take on this standard slab distinctive. Wheat tortilla and black beans are both available, and it comes wrapped in friendly, quick service.
author: Jason B.

description: My burrito was barely filled with anything, 1/3 of it was just a tortilla. It was very dry and the carnitas were just 1 massive chunk that was hard to bite. It was obviously microwaved and not actually cooked.
author: Ivan R.

description: Working if FiDi, I've tried all the super burritos (I prefer carne asada) within walking distance and Mana is the best. Salsa on the table is great as well.
author: Gary C.

description: Dropped by for a late night snack after Tunnel Top. Being super buzzed, the baby burritos were the perfect size for one person and the mini tacos and fries were great for sharing with the group. Food was 3.5/5 but they get a bump for being friendly and quick with filling/affordable portions. Most of the menu starts around $5-7 and costs a little more for add ons, which is pretty good for downtown.
author: Grace T.

description:
I was a little hesitant about eating food from a restaurant almost in a tunnel, though my taco cravings got the best of me!  Each taco is served on a double corn tortilla (not freshly griddled, but from a bag) with the meat of your choice, onions, salsa and cilantro.  They offer about nine fillings that could be added to a variety of Mexican dishes besides tacos.  The tacos tasted like something from a Mission taco truck: authentic and good value for the price, but no competition to the more gourmet nouveau tacos popping up around town.  It's an OK place; they do a decent job of taqueria food just as is done at many other decent taquerias.

Carne Asada: At least the cubes had a good singe to them.  The flavor was lacking and it was a bit tough.

Pastor: Nice crispy cubes of pork with loads of seasoning.  Probably my favorite here.

Carnitas: Achieved the difficult task of having crisp portions and moist portions.  It was tasty, though a little bland.

Chorizo: Super rich and full of spices.  Good thing the meat portion is kind of light in this taco else I might go on grease overload.

Barbacoa: Enjoyed the texture, it was like carnitas but without the crunch.  A little bland though.
author: Adam B.

description: I am from LA so I appreciate some god authentic Mexican food. It has been surprisingly hard to find in SF but I'm so happy I discover this place. I usualy get the carnitas burrito which is delicious and I've also tried the nachos, also really good. Its right under the stockton tunnel near sutter so if you're around union square its really easy to get to. Yummm
author: Samantha G.

description: We ordered online via grubhub and the food never turned up! Contacted them directly and they wouldn't pick up the phone (kept going to voicemail). Contacted grubhub customer support and they found out that the order got lost or was delivered to the wrong people (we couldn't get a straight answer). Thankfully grub hub organised a refund. Really bad experience overall. Would not reccomend for delivery.
author: Kieran B.

description:
So I'm chowing down on my super pollo asado burrito with wheat tortilla, when I suddenly clamp down on something small and hard. It felt like a tooth. After reminding myself that I definitely lost all my baby teeth years ago, I cautiously fished out the culprit: a tiny black rock. Disgusting! 

If you're wondering whether I kept eating the burrito, the answer is yes, because it would take a lot for me to go out and buy another lunch when there's a delicious one sitting right in front of me. But I did feel a little grossed out with each bite.

I guess I could say their burritos rock, but instead I think I just won't be eating there anymore.
author: Jenni L.

description: Inexpensive, close, delivered in 1/2 hour (through Eat24)...oh, and the food was unbelievably delicious. The Chili Relleno is a star - barely breaded, 'cuz it's got nothing to hide - deep, dark green chili with tender flesh, and just enough seeds for heat. I may have an inappropriate dream about it.
author: Holly R.

description:
I discovered Taqueria Mana while sitting at the bus stop at the bottom of the Stockton Tunnel. Wedged between a liquor store and a massage parlor (yeah, not the kind where you'd have a spa day), it doesn't look promising from the outside. However, Mana had dropped off menus in my building and the food looked pretty tasty, and was delightfully cheap, so I decided to give it a go.

The inside is clean and festive, with soccer blaring away on the TV. The service was quick, and the staff friendly. I ordered a chicken chimichanga, and perused the beverage cooler while I waited. They have a big selection, with your usual standards, Jarritos sodas, and more exotic fare like peach nectar. 

I got my chimi to go, and was surprised by how heavy the to-go box was. It's definitely enough for two servings, and the ingredients were fresh. The downside was that there was no spice or seasoning to the chicken or salsa, and the guac was runny. I'm sure if you ask they can make it spicy, and it's not that anything was bad - it just isn't as good as many of the chimichangas I've had in the past.
author: Stacey L.

description:
While this place may look authentic, it ends there - you can't even smell good food inside the joint!

We had a super pork taco w/ refried beans, salsa, sour cream and avocado - $4 - pork wasn't very good

horchata - no flavor, just sweet 

chips - ok, doesn't come w/ anything

Unless we are desperate or super hungry like we were, no way will we return for less than decent Mexican fare.
author: Gloria H.

description: Worked in the area and only had 30 minutes for lunch.   There is a short line if you come during the lunch rush.  I've had better and I have had worst.  A mini taco deal for $5 is two small tacos plus soft drink.  Not a big taco, but three bites and you are done.   I like the burritos here better.  The tables could use a wipe.  The staff is always friendly.   What I don't get is they list horchata but the guy always says they just ran out.   How about just taping over the horchata sign with duct tape?
author: Rey D.

description: This place is right around from the office, so it's one of my go to's. Food is always good, staff is friendly, and I LOVE their salsa!
author: Marcia S.

description: It's a great and cheap place. I like the food there. It's super clean and CHEAP. Good is food. Definitely should try their MANA BURGER!
author: Xavier M.

description: Came here on a rainy night because it was close to our hotel. Really nice people and surprisingly yummy. #2 super burrito w/carne asade. Worth the walk in the rain!
author: Vici K.

description: Beware of this restaurant! Unfortunately, I received food poisoning from this restaurant on Monday night.  I ordered their chicken burrito. Not only was I severely sick to my stomach for the next 24 hours, the delivery was 90 minutes late AND when I called about my delivery, no one spoke any English besides telling me "Call back 10 minutes". Do not order from here.
author: Sarah S.

description: I've trie the grilled chicken and their carne asada but nothing comes even close to their el pastor. Their tacos are perfect and the baby burrito is perfect as well without making you feel like you ate a brick. They don't sell any beer which is awful but there's a lquor store 15 feet away : )
author: Ryan C.

description:
I force myself not to eat here cause it is so great, I would eat here again and again, EVERYDAY!
I have had the Super taco (any meat and you are good), the mini taco (good for a quick snack) and the nachos. All fabulous and such awesome prices. The mini is only $2, and so much meat! 
Hurry hurry hurry! It is so good there. Don't let the outside scare you away.
author: Rüsh A.

description:
Wet burrito! Yes, I ate the entire thing, okay? Stop staring. But yes, I had a giant wet burrito about the size of my head filled with delicious al pastor, covered in enchilada sauce, guac and sour cream. All for ~$7. The al pastor is some of the tastiest that I've had in a while.

A hike from the office and closely located to the Stockton Tunnel, it's worth the long walk. The place is small - about 6 tables and seating for ~20ish people - so best not to go with a big group.
author: Wendy L.

description: This place is great!  I had the "Super vegetarian nachos" with black beans and it hit the spot.  Very fast and friendly service.  It is definitely in a random location and has a hole-in-the-wall vibe, particularly from the outside.  Try it out anyway!  I will be back for more.
author: Val P.

description: Hmm. Coming from Southern California this was a disappointment.  Carnitas was dry, avo was brown, and food lacked flavor. Hot sauce was bomb to say the least.
author: Justin B.

description:
Yum! I like Union Square options a little better now. 

I would not have found this place without the help of a 4Square push notification. It is on Stockton just before you go under the bridge.

Pollo taco w/black beans was big & chicken was moist and well-seasoned. Carnitas mini tacos are not too mini and have all the right fixings - cilantro, onion, hot salsa, no beans. Guacamole and chips were very fresh and tasty.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
I got a burrito and it was delicious!  The meat was well flavored and fresh.  Having just moved up from SoCal and expecting Mexican food to not be as good up here (especially in the financial district), I was pleasantly surprised.  

The only downside is that their lack of carne asada fries on the menu. :)
author: M S.

description: Had them deliver food to our office in SoMa last week and it was spot on. Prices were great and everyone enjoyed the food. I was craving Pozole, so I ended up getting that, but wasn't too impressed with it. I must try their chimichangas next time. Also, I love their online ordering, but you can't substitute or personalize the orders.
author: Samantha H.

description: YUM! I tried to this place for lunch while waiting to check into my room. The food was very good although, I think I picked the wrong beans to put on my taco (refried). The young guy at the register was very sweet, patient and nice. The service was fast and I can tell that this is a family run business. The lady making the food seems to really put effort into every dish. This shows and comes through in the flavor and taste of the food. This place is great for a quick bite and definitely hits the spot. It also isn't a bank breaker. I took off one star for the location and noise coming from outside of the restaurant. Other than that, I will definitely be back during my next San Fran stay!
author: Shareon S.

description:
A microwave? Really? You have signs bragging Fresh Authentic Mexican Food and then pop my meal in a microwave before handing it to me??

Despite that, the taste was there. The food is good but a $10 dinner place shouldn't be thrown in a microwave.
author: Mack D.

description: Visiting California for business and wanted Mexican. Found this on GPS and looked at reviews. Was a little worried at 3stars but tried it anyways. I got nachos they were excellent and friend got quesadilla they were both amazing.
author: Just A.

description: I fell in love with this place!  I saw my Orthodontist and asked the ladies in the office if they knew a good Mexican restaurant near by. They sent me here, to this little hole in the wall, one block from the office!!!  Near Union Square!!  I had a cheese enchilada, salad, rice and beans, for 6 bucks!!  It was sooooooo good!!!
author: Blondie R.

description: Pretty solid Mexican food in the Union Square area! They have the standards covered from burritos to tacos to nachos with every possible type of meat and even veggie options. One favorite I recently spotted on the menu is chilaquiles! Not too many restaurants offer this, so I'm excited to try it. They are quick, extremely reasonable for Union Square, and authentically delicious!
author: Anna R.

description:
Decent Mexican joint in Union Square.  The owners are evangelical Christians, hence the giant mural of Moses parting the Red Sea, which is cool... but one time, they had *Chick Tracts* sitting next to the register.

Chick Tracts (google them, read them, be converted... or profoundly disturbed) are little cartoon booklets made by some weirdo who is about as doom and gloom as it gets.  Topics include Jews going to hell despite the fact they were good and noble people because they didn't accept Jesus as their lord and saviour; gays ruining everything; Satan posing as a Fonz-style cool cat who gets you in train wrecks and tells you "YOU GOOFED!" as he commits you to the fiery pits of blackest hell, etc.  Kind of surprised me to see them there.

Available reading material aside, the food is pretty good: it's WAY less greasy than what you generally find in a quick-and-easy taco bar.  The guac has always been adequately fresh, and the staff is friendly.  The burritos come really, really fast: a few times, by the time my credit card went through, they had it sitting on the counter!

The fresh salsa that they have on the tables is amazing, way more flavorful than the stuff they have prepacked in the fridge.
author: Tristan S.

description: The food is great and authentic! But they always forget to make some of the food that we've ordered. That has happened the last four times.
author: Madeline O.

description:
Couldn't muster up the energy to leave the house tonight, and I was craving some Mexican food. I searched Mexican on Seamless, and found Taqueria Mana with the best reviews. We ordered a Shrimp Quesadilla and a Steak Ranchero, Coke and a Mango Kerns for $25. I wouldn't say it was pricey, but for the quality of the food, I would say it was definitely overpriced. This was subpar mexican food. I've had better TexMex parading as Mexican fare. Everything was flavorless, the rice was overcooked, but underdone (I don't even know how you can accomplish that). The steak was tough and gristly and drowning in tomato paste. Shrimp quesadillas were soggy and the shrimp overcooked. Everything came in paper take out boxes, which were totally soggy and structural unsound by the time they arrived at the house. And a thing about the delivery: the average delivery time is estimated to be between 30 and 45 minutes,  yet our food arrived over an hour later, just shy of 90 minutes. And to top it off, they subbed peach Kerns instead, and didn't even warn me. Needless to say, my little man was disappointed. 
Cold, flavorless, and unsatisfying. If you have no idea what mexican food is supposed to taste like (mr. New York who gave this place 5 stars), then you will be pleased with the cheap eats. If you want real mexican food, stop being a pussy and get your ass up and go to the Mission. You'll be sorry you didn't. I was. *grumble*
author: Zehra A.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been here once every 1-2 weeks for the past 5 months. I came here when I did a no carbs diet (ordered the fajitas without rice + tortillas), when I stopped caring (Super Burrito with everything and marinated pork), when I decided to cut my portions down (Baby Burrito), and when I decided to try Pescetarianism (Shrimp Burrito). A lot of diet changes in a few months, but Taqueria Mana has always tasted good no matter what I restricted (not restricted) myself from eating.
author: Molina T.

description: Delicious veggie super burrito and a veggie taco that was the size of my face for $10? I aint mad at it. It's literally a hole. in a wall. the man and woman behind the counter were super nice and accomodating, and the food was pretty damn good! its two blocks from my office so here's to hoping i can contain myself :)
author: Liz M.

description: Trying this place for the first time, their super burrito is AMAZING.  Best burrito I've had in a long long time, maybe even best in the Bay.
author: Carl M.

description: This is super tasty hole-in-the wall cheap burrito place near Union Square. I highly recommend Taqueria Mana...look for the specials which are impressive deals.
author: Cameron K.

description:
I give:

2 stars for incredibly fresh & delicious guacamole at 8pm (they close at 10pm), tasty black beans, fresh salsa w/ chunks of garlic in it, fresh squeezed cold orange juice (we watched them squeeze it) & a happy boyfriend (apparently his baby chicken burrito was great)

2 stars for their actually being a taqueria in Union Square.

2 stars for fast & friendly service.

1/2 star for the hilarious Telemundo program they had on & 1/2 star for the bad painting of Moses.


Then taketh away:

Minus 2 stars for stale chips & crunchy rice b/c it had gotten hard from sitting out.

Minus 2 stars for the cost - $20 for a super veggie taco, side of rice & beans, baby chicken burrito, side of guac & 2 drinks...anywhere else I know that's cheap, but this is SF where I can get a good taco for a $2 and a smile.

Bottom line:

It's a downtown taqueria off the Powell St. BART that isn't scary to walk to & is open til 10pm on the weekends. The guac is seriously the bomb - it was almost the consistency of butter. I would never go out of my way to eat here b/c The Mission is a less than 10 min walk from my house, but it gives my taco lovin' heart peace to know it's there.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Great food!!!!  The burrito's are fabulous - HUGE, tacos are scrumptious and the guacamole is out of this world!!!!!!!
author: Nancy S.

description: Taqueria Mana satisfied my lunchtime carne asade super burrito craving without forcing me to trek to the Mission.
author: Miriam W.

description: Placed an order with Taqueria Mana via Grubhub. Pretend I'm okay with the fact that our food arrived cold and 60+ minutes after we placed the order. The fact that I ordered a chile relleno and it came undercooked (the pepper was crunchy...) is pretty unacceptable and not very appetizing. The beans that come with their food appear to be grayish brown pinto beans that are slightly undercooked and completely bland. I will never order from this place again.
author: Gina B.

description:
What trumps charging $7 for a disturbingly average burrito? Having the audacity to charge an extra 75¢ for a cold, greasy bag of chips. 

While there are few options in the neighborhood for Mexican food you are much better off making the trek to the Mission or settling for some pizza from Uncle Vito's. I won't be making the same mistake again.
author: phil h.

description: Nothing beats the taquerias scattered throughout the Mission district, but the food here will satisfy the cravings enough if you're trapped in Union Square. My recent meal here consisted of a super chicken quesadilla with black beans and rice and an extra side of guacamole. I didn't like the chicken too much...mostly white meat that was on the dry and flavorless side. Everything else was tasty though. Next time I'll try the carne asada or carnitas...perhaps in an enchillada or over nachos.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Where to start my review?? Well I was in Union Square to buy a suit from Banana Republic so I wanted to grab something before I went. Looked on yelp and nothing really jumped out until I found this small place. Decided to try this place out and fast forward to eating here.

Took BART downtown and walked around a little bit and decided to head over to try out a burrito. On the way, right before I get to the place this guy just starts pissing on the sidewalk and my head just goes WTF!! My appetite is slightly ruined but I have hope that at least a decent burrito will satisfy my hunger. Step into the place and just order a regular burrito with steak and black beans. Once I take the first bite, I just go ahhhhhh!! Continued to finish my burrito and I appreciate the fact that they have a lot of pictures up so you can see what a lot of the items look like which is helpful. I'm definitely eating here if I want some Mexican near Union Square whether or not somebody is pissing on the sidewalk.
author: Steven C.

description: I have been there just the 1 time.    Nice Peeps,  Good prices,  aa short 2 block walk from my building.   I ordered a Steak regular Burrito, spicy.    Pretty Darned tasty!
author: Jerry P.

description:
Great find, Great Mexican food burrito joint at reasonable but not dirt cheap prices. It is a true Mexican place...not some random restaurant that happens to throw up a Mexican name and make tacos. Nachos are great, burritos are awesome and the guac is real good...

It is located next to the Stockton tunnel and you feel a bit like you are entering a shady massage parlor (which happens to be next door, I think its called Green Hands something or other and is open 24 hours...)
author: Joey P.

description: I was walking by, dropped in for a quick bite.  Their $3 taco (pork, spicy) was pretty good! I'll have to come by again another time and order more than 1 to make a meal of it. Not the best taco I've ever had, but certainly left me satisfied.
author: Rob Z.

description: Thanks to all of the Yelpers! we discovered this little Mexican Yummy Hole in the Wall.  We ordered a bean and cheese burrito, rice, and chicken tacos.
